channel.title: Problem with the Matrix 718 Server
channel.description:
So i got a problem with launching the server: [url=http://postimage.org/image/9dyo9b1qt/][img]http://s2.postimage.org/9dyo9b1qt/Knipsel.jpg[/img][/url]
[s]Is this because the cache is in the wrong place or what?[/s] :confused: [Cache is in the right folder]
Something wrong with the launcher?
Does someone know how to fix it?

item.title: Problem with the Matrix 718 Server
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“shai130, post:8, topic:476955”][quote author=rastanoob2 link=topic=595118.msg4190880#msg4190880 date=1356794480]
So i got a problem with launching the server:

Is this because the cache is in the wrong place or what? [Cache is in the right folder]

Something wrong with the launcher?

Does someone know how to fix it?
[/quote]
Edit the run with this:

@echo off
@title RUN MATRIX
java -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -server -cp bin;data/libs/netty-3.5.2.Final.jar;data/libs/FileStore.jar com.rs.Launcher false false true
pause[/quote]

That wont work.

Instead of guessing, and proposing a solution from your guess (which is very counter-productive), look at the error.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: com/rs/Launcher : Unsupported Major.minor version 51.0

A quick google search gives us the following answer which states that the reason this error is caused is because you’re trying to run the file in a lower JVM (from Java 6) than what the file was compiled with (Java 7).

You can either recompile the classes (which may not work, if the newer classes have Java 7 syntax), or you can (preferrably) download and install JDK 7, and update the environment variables to point to the new JDK7 folder

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with the Matrix 718 Server
item.dc:creator: @shai130 shai130
item.description:
@shai130 wrote:

[quote=“rastanoob2, post:1, topic:476955”]So i got a problem with launching the server:

Is this because the cache is in the wrong place or what? [Cache is in the right folder]

Something wrong with the launcher?

Does someone know how to fix it?[/quote]
Edit the run with this:

@echo off
@title RUN MATRIX
java -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow -server -cp bin;data/libs/netty-3.5.2.Final.jar;data/libs/FileStore.jar com.rs.Launcher false false true
pause

Read full topic
